title: Food as Medicine: Prebiotic Foods
author: The Children's Hospital
description: This resource from Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP) discusses prebiotics and how to add them to your diet to support digestion and immune health.
cleaned_text: Food as Medicine: Prebiotic Foods Published on Published on Certain plant-based food-derived substances that help feed the good bacteria in your child's gut are called prebiotics. Prebiotics are food for the healthy or "good" gut bacteria that live within the GI (gastrointestinal) tract. Although all prebiotics are fiber, not all fibers are prebiotics. Here are some foods that naturally contain prebiotics, and some ways to try them with your family.
